title: Rinaldini NV Vecchio Moro  (Lambrusco dell'Emilia)
description: Inky black and foamy, this has wet earth, prune and peach pit aromas. The dry, vinous palate offers dried blackberry and crushed grape flavors set against firm acidity and slightly grainy tannins. It closes on a bitter note.

title: Pere Ventura NV Tresor Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: A yeasty, bready nose and a fairly flat palate are not all that vibrant. This cava tastes yeasty like the aromas suggest, but also offers a bitter melon flavor component on the way to a soft, wayward finish.

title: Los Monteros NV Brut Metodo Tradicional Macabeo (Cava)
description: Apple and peach aromas are clean at first but struggle to stay vital. This is citrusy on the tongue, with acidity similar to orange juice. Mild flavors of orange and pink grapefruit finish light and fresh.

title: Viñas del Vero 2015 Garnacha-Syrah (Somontano)
description: A lean but lucid nose shows piquant floral scents. The palate on this Garnacha-Syrah is choppy and abrupt, with high acidity and rubbery tannins. Medicinal red plum and red-currant flavors finish with a rubbery grip.

title: Seven Daughters 2015 Crisp White Winemaker's Blend White (California)
description: This wine is light in body, fruity and floral in flavor and smooth on the palate. Blended from seven varietals, it has peach and jasmine aromas, very generous fruit flavors that flirt with sweetness and a lush mouthfeel.

title: Tarantas 2016 Organic Tempranillo (Utiel-Requena)
description: Spicy berry fruit aromas are straightforward and pretty good. This wine feels firm and centered, with plum, berry and cherry flavors. A reasonably deep finish offers residual berry notes and peppery spice.

title: Haras de Pirque 2016 Albaclara Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley-Maipo Valley)
description: An almost colorless luster and oily aromas of green apple set the stage for this stony, lean SB. Briny, citric flavors are common but limited, while the finish is similar, only lighter.

title: Harbes Family Vineyard 2014 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Notes of pressed apple and tangerine peels abound in this full-bodied Chardonnay. Rounded edges and soft acidity make it approachably creamy. Drink now through 2019.

title: La Spinetta 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)
description: Grilled vegetable, celery and camphor aromas lead the nose of this wine. The palate is raw, tight and tense, showing oak, roasted coffee bean and bitter sage flavors alongside raspy tannins.

title: La Zorra 2014 La Moza Calabrés Garnacha (Sierra de Salamanca)
description: Earthy cherry aromas are downright raw, with a touch of green grass woven in. An acidic, choppy palate follows the nose, while this Garnacha from the Sierra de Salamanca region tastes of tart red currant and cranberry. A crisp finish is fresh but abrupt.

title: La Zorra 2014 La Moza Suelo de Pizarra Rufete (Sierra de Salamanca)
description: Aromas of herbal red-berry fruits, tomato, leather and grass lead to a snappy, tight, drawn palate. Red-currant and plum-skin flavors are racy, while this Rufete, a variety rarely seen, is grabby and fairly astringent on the finish.

title: Ladera 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From vineyards on Howell Mountain and Oak Knoll, this wine is bristling in acidity, with a taste of lemon peel and grapefruit. Secondary characteristics of peas and pineapple confound as a stony texture adds breadth.

title: Kestrel 2012 Winemaker's Select Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: At five years old, this shows green pepper, dark fruit, tar and barrel spice scents followed by restrained fruit and barrel flavors. Its jalapeño-like notes are distracting.

title: Zanasi NV  Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro
description: This lean, racy red offers red cherry, citrus zest and raisin notes. Firm acidity contributes to its bone-dry finish.

title: Coyote Canyon 2012 Tres Cruces Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine's barrel spice, barnyard, coffee and vanilla aromas lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors tinged with a strong, distracting gamy note.

title: Cantina di Sorbara 2016 Emma  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)
description: This sweet red sparkler has pretty violet and red berry aromas and a vibrant palate that doles out ripe cherry, raspberry and candied orange peel notes. Bright acidity keeps it fresh, balancing the sweetness.

title: Cantina di Sorbara NV Il Duomo Amabile  (Lambrusco di Modena)
description: Blackberry jam and plum cake aromas lead the nose of this simple but well made semisweet sparkling wine. The palate mirrors the nose, while bright acidity lends freshness.

title: Domaine de l'Echelette 2016  Mâcon-Cruzille
description: This wine is crisp and deliciously fruity. With bright acidity, apple and citrus flavors and a strong mineral texture, it is ready to drink.

title: Château du Carrubier 2014 Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This firm and tannic wine is more structure than fruit. It is dense with a dry core. The acidity suggests that there may be some fruit there, although the rest of the wine is ready to drink.

title: Browne Family Vineyards 2015 & White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Bright aromas of ripe peach, apricot, flower and jasmine lead to off-dry stone fruit flavors in this simple, straightforward quaffer.

title: Batán de Salas 2015 Syrah (Somontano)
description: Aromas of dry brush, wiry cherry and road tar open this Syrah. In the mouth, high acidity creates sheer angularity. Plum and tart black-currant flavors are staunch and rubbery on a mildly abrasive finish.

title: Original House Wine 2016 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is pale pink in color, with aromas suggesting herbs, cherry and red apple. It drinks off dry and is an easy-drinking porch pounder.

title: Ricossa 2013  Barbaresco
description: This opens with toasted oak, eucalyptus and violet aromas. The palate is tight and compressed, showing toasted oak and black spice flavors alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent, mouth-drying finish.

title: San Pedro 2016 Castillo de Molina Rosé (Chile)
description: Mildly overripe cantaloupe aromas set up a palate with a rip of malic acid. Short, slightly bitter and peppery citrus flavors don't add much to a modest finish.

title: Santa Alicia 2015 Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled Merlot (Maipo Valley)
description: Herbal berry and plum aromas are earthy at best and a touch green at worst. Salty plum and berry flavors are tomatoey and chunky, while drying tannins and herbal flavors drive the finish.
designation: Gran Reserva de Los Andes Estate Bottled

title: Fulkerson 2016 Estate Muskat Ottonel (Finger Lakes)
description: Fresh stone fruit and apple notes have an earthy undertone in this light-bodied, dry wine. It's a bit thin in concentration but finishes refreshingly. Drink now.

title: Finn Hill 2016 The Gnome Corfu Crossing Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine's red apple, flower and lees aromas lead to off-dry, leesy fruit flavors that seem a bit heavy and weighed down.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Mâcon-Villages
description: This wine is crisp and refreshingly fruity. A lively texture gives brightness, and a light touch of acidity finishes the wine on a citrus note. Drink now.

title: Marcel Couturier 2015 La Cour des Bois  (Saint-Véran)
description: Spiced-apple aromas lead to a soft, perfumed wine that has a crisp, fruity edge. The apple and green-plum flavors give attractive acidity. Drink now.

title: Carmen 2016 Wave Series Left Wave Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Tropical fruit and hay aromas open this plump but basic SB that's low on acidity. Low-energy green-melon flavors are a bit briny, while a lack of punchy acidity leaves a short finish.
